                                                                    ITSSQuick Start GuidesCurrent page:  Technology Quick Start Guide for Faculty
                        
    		Technology Quick Start Guide for Faculty
    	Getting OnlineGetting connected to Eduroam on campusGetting online off-campusGlobalProtect VPNKeep TeachingEssential resources for teaching in a virtual environment.Account & Password ManagementMost campus systems are accessed with your Wildcat Account, which can be managed with Account Center. Chico State PortalThe Chico State Portal provides a central location for many of the resources faculty need. These include Office 365, LinkedIn Learning, PeopleSoft, Box, CSU Learn, Chico State Alerts, Employee Absence Management Self Service, Blackboard Learn, and more.IT Support PortalThe IT Support Portal contains the IT Service Catalog where you can request services and technical support, and the IT Knowledge Base.Technology & Learning ProgramTLP empowers faculty to use educational technology to design courses that maximize student learning. They provide services and online resources to help you build your instructional materials and plan your online delivery. Supported resources include Blackboard Learn, Turnitin, Kaltura, and more.Learning Management SystemThe campus is transitioning from Blackboard Learn to Canvas. During the transition, some students may have courses in one or both platforms.Microsoft 365 / Office 365Office 365 includes your Exchange Email account and other resources.BoxBox is the approved cloud-based content storage and collaboration service for university staff and faculty. More information about storing and sharing files with Box is available in the Knowledge Base.CSU LearnCSU Learn is a learning management system that allows the CSU to assign, track, and leverage content ranging from mandatory professional development to compliance.IT SecurityFaculty are often targeted by scams, phishing, computer viruses, and ransomware. Faculty accounts should be secured with Duo 2-Step Verification.Technology and Equity InclusionTEIN provides support for inclusive technology and assists with setting up technology accommodations.LinkedIn LearningLinkedIn Learning offers expert video tutorials on a wide variety of topics. Faculty have unlimited access to all of these videos.Information TechnologyMeriam Library, Room 338www.csuchico.edu/itSupport Our CollegeMore in our divisionComputing & Communication ServicesCreative Media & TechnologyEnterprise ApplicationsInformation SecurityInstitutional Research and Strategic Analytics (IRSA)IT Administrative ServiceIT Support ServicesTechnology Equity and Inclusion
We acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus. We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.Contact UsNeed Help?FacebookFacebookTwitterTwitterInstagramInstagramReport an accessibility issueReport a broken link on this pageTitle IXPrivacy PolicyCalifornia State University, Chico400 West First StreetChico, CA 95929Copyright © 2023 All Rights Reserved
